snippet: Security analysts in South Korea and the United States expressed cautious optimism that after weeks of threats, both sides might be ready to calm tensions.
abstract: North Korea shifts its tone after weeks of escalating threats, instead accusing the United States and its allies of trying to strip it of its nuclear arsenal; US and South Korea are putting  new focus on offering talks instead of meeting North Korean provocations with harsh warnings that included deploying nuclear-capable stealth bombers on practice run over South Korea.

byline.original: By CHOE SANG-HUN and RICK GLADSTONE
byline.contributor: Choe Sang-Hun reported from Seoul, and Rick Gladstone from New York.

lead_paragraph: Security analysts in South Korea and the United States expressed cautious optimism that after weeks of threats, both sides might be ready to calm tensions.

headline.seo: North Korea Tones Down Rhetoric Against U.S.
headline.main: North Korea Tones Down Language, Giving Hope for Dialogue
headline.print_headline: North Korea Tones Down Language, Giving Hope for Dialogue
